description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

歌曲&歌手背景：
Wake Me Up When September Ends是收藏在Green Day（绿日乐队）《American Idiot 》专辑里一首非常好听的歌曲，中文名称《在九月结束的时候唤醒我》（《九月末叫醒我》），也有网友幽默地将该歌曲名翻译成《一觉睡到国庆节》。
歌名来源
The song deals with the death of lead singer Billie Joe Armstrong's father, who died in September 1982 when Armstrong was a child. Billie Joe Armstrong was 10 years old when his father died of throat cancer. At the funeral Billie Joe Armstrong couldn't handle it, so he ran home and locked himself in his room. His mother, worried, ran after him, only to find the door locked. She asked him to come out, but he only said, "Wake me up when September ends."

绿日乐队(Green Day)，又称年轻岁月、庞克教父，美国著名庞克乐队。是20世纪90年代之后美国朋克音乐复兴时期的重要乐队之一，他们的成员深受70年代朋克音乐时期经典乐队影响，而简明上口的流畅旋律让他们的音乐更便于流行。根据美国唱片业协会（RIAA）的资料，绿日乐队的全球唱片销售量高达5000万张，单单在美国就创下超过2100万的佳绩。专辑《American Idiot》曾获得第47届格莱美最佳摇滚专辑奖。

模唱部分
Summer has come and passed
The innocent can never last
Wake me up when September ends
Like my father's come to pass
Seven years has gone so fast
Wake me up when September ends
Here comes the rain again
Falling from the stars
Drenched in my pain again
Becoming who we are
As my memory rests
But never forgets what I lost
Wake me up when September ends
Summer has come and passed
The innocent can never last
Wake me up when September ends
Ring out the bells again
Like we did when spring began
Wake me up when September ends
Here comes the rain again
Falling from the stars
Drenched in my pain again
Becoming who we are
As my memory rests
But never forgets what I lost
Wake me up when September ends
Summer has come and passed
The innocent can never last
Wake me up when September ends
Like my father's come to pass
Twenty years has gone so fast
Wake me up when September ends
Wake me up when September ends
Wake me up when September ends

title: 小威能否创美网历史？(2/2)

description:
History first though, with Selma, the first feature about the Reverend Dr Martin Luther King, Jr. It's now nearly a half century since Dr King led civil rights marchers through Alabama from the town of Selma to Montgomery. At that point in the south, black people were often denied the vote. In 1965, the Selma voting rights movement brought together African-American politicians, churchmen and women, students and workers in defiance of Governor George Wallace and his conservative white police force. The director Ava DuVernay is making history too, as the first African-American woman to be nominated for a Golden Globe for directing, while the film is itself in contention for the Best Picture Oscar. David Oyelowo's striking performance, though, has been overlooked by both American and British Academy Awards, which is a puzzle. He's as convincing in the recreations of the set-piece speeches as in the domestic scenes or discussions with political colleagues - all aspects that DuVernay wanted to bring out in Selma, not so much setting the record straight as putting it in full.

"Well there's never been a film made with Dr King at the centre released by studios and so there wasn't a lot of precedent. I had to go on. It was really imagining him outside of the iconography, this homogenised view of him as someone who was known by a catchphrase 'I have a dream', someone who we see more as a holiday and a statue and a street name and not as a man who did great things. And so our goal was to really humanise him, you know, let him come to life, let him be more than the few facts we learn in dusty history books and to let him live and breathe and move us."

title: 塞尔玛（有声）

description:
《英文天天写》是沪江社团一档写作类社刊，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

          

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Trickle
Trickle means a small amout of liquid is flowing. What is trickling? Why is it trickling? What will happen later?
This week's topic: They trickled into the hall... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) tear trickling down one's face
2) a trickling stream
3) audience trickled out of the hall after the performance
4) sand trickled through the hourglass
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

By the time the pair finished the dessert, they got ready to leave. His guest, the interior designer, expressed how much he liked the food, thanking his host for the hospitality. Hodge smiled and said, “Anytime. That was my pleasure.” While they were on their way to leave the restaurant, Hodge was still observing his surroundings, taking in everything. It was close to the end of the lunch hour rush, but there were still quite a few tables of customers remaining. Some customers were still trickling in, taking advantage of the fact there was no need to wait for a table.
